CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW DATE provides as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Where a bankruptcy order has been made , the court may from time to time , on the application of the official receiver or the trustee of the bankrupt ’s estate , order ORG to re - direct and send or deliver to the official receiver or trustee or otherwise any postal packet ( within the meaning of LAW DATE ) which would otherwise be sent or delivered by them to the bankrupt at such place or places as may be specified in the order .
CARDINAL . An order under this section has effect for such period , not exceeding DATE , as may be specified in the order . ”

CARDINAL . Trustees in Bankruptcy have other statutory powers , which are more stringent than the power to apply for a re - direction order but which may nonetheless need to be used , in appropriate cases , if Trustees are properly to investigate the bankrupt ’s affairs for the ultimate benefit of his creditors . In particular , under LAW DATE a ORG may obtain a warrant authorising him to seize property , books and/or records falling into the debtor ’s estate . Furthermore , section CARDINAL of the Act allows the court ( on application by a ORG ) to summon a variety of persons before it to give an affidavit and/or produce documents .

CARDINAL . A bankrupt owes a statutory duty , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW DATE , to give to the ORG such information as to his affairs , attend meetings with the ORG and do such other things as the ORG may reasonably require for the carrying out of his relevant functions .
